content.description: A long boulder problem with great flow and committing moves. Start low on a rail. Make your way towards the lip of the cave on good slots and jugs. When jugs run out, head left on crimps through an awesome hueco/scoop feature (crux) to pocketed rock just below the lip. Find the path of least resistance to top out.
content.protection: Lots of pads and a spotter or two.
content.location: Right side of the Superfly Wall, topping out just left of an impressive point.

content.description: Start with low pockets and bad feet. Make a long reach to a crimp, decipher the sequence through small crimps and sidepulls, and snag the rail at the top of the face. Head up and left to top out on the catwalk.
content.location: On the left side of the Superfly Wall, marked by an obvious righthand crimp/sidepull on the face.

content.description: Start on a big flat jug in a crumbly looking corner. Work your way up, traverse right on good holds, then bust a big move up to the lip. Top out and escape left on the catwalk. Surely this has been done before. If you know the FA and route name, fix it!
content.location: Currently the farthest left line on the Superfly Wall.

content.description: Start matching on an obvious jug with feet under the short roof. Make a few moves up good holds to a drop-off jug about 10 feet off the deck. Could maybe be topped out when dry?

A quality sit/squat start to Fly By. Start on a low rail. Bust straight out to some crimps and an undercling and work your way left to the obvious jug of the stand start. Hold the swing and finish as for Fly By Stand.
A cliffline cave area with quality established lines and potential for more testpieces.
